required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Frequency of Limitation of Activity in Patients With Persistent Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Frequency of Limitation of Activity, Depending on Gender and Age-group, in Patients With Persistent Asthma Consulting a General Practitioner

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the frequency of limitation of activity, depending on gender and age-group, in patients with persistent asthma consulting a general practitioner

primary_outcome.measure: To describe the frequency of limitations of activities in patients with persistent asthma depending on gender and age-group.
To describe, depending on gender and age-group, the nature of the activities limited, the degree of limitation and the impact on the patient's daily life.

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the nature of the activities limited, the degree of limitation and the impact on the patient's daily life according to the level of asthma control

To describe, depending on gender and age-group, the activities that need to be specifically investigated in routine clinical practice due to their greater impact on the patient's quality of life, and which could indicate poorly controlled asthma
To describe the main characteristics and initial management for all patients of the survey

study_pop.textblock: First 3 consecutive patients with persistent asthma seen by general practitioner receiving long-term maintenance treatment with inhaled steroids

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- persistent asthma receiving long-term maintenance treatment with inhaled steroids (alone or in combination with other drugs)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of COPD
